slant.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to slope or make something slope in a particular direction
slant.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The sun’s rays slanted through the trees.
slant.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to provide information in a way that unfairly supports one opinion, gives an advantage to one group etc
slant.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The researchers were accused of slanting their findings in favour of their own beliefs.
slant.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a way of writing about or thinking about a subject that is based on a particular opinion or set of ideas
slant.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The article had an anti-union slant.
Each article has a slightly different slant on the situation.
Recent events have put a new slant on the president’s earlier comments.
slant.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The house seems to be built on a steep slant.
